stanza.line: Thou blind fool Love what dost thou to mine (a)eyes(/a)
That they behold and see not what they (b)see(/b)
They know what beauty is see where it (a)lies(/a)
Yet what the best is take the worst to (b)be(/b)
Be anchored in the bay where all men (d)ride(/d)
Why of eyes' falsehood hast thou forged (c)hooks(/c)
Whereto the judgment of my heart is (d)tied(/d)
Why should my heart think that a several (e)plot(/e)
Which my heart knows the wide world's common (f)place(/f)
Or mine eyes seeing this say this is (e)not(/e)
To put fair truth upon so foul a (f)face(/f)
In things right true my heart and eyes have (g)erred(/g)
And to this false plague are they now (g)transferred(/g)
